amendments.right: The right to freedom of speech.
The right to be secure from all unreasonable searches and seizures of their person, houses, papers, and possessions.
Protection against double jeopardy and against self-incrimination.
The right to a public trial without unnecessary delay, to have a lawyer, to know the accusers, the nature of the charges, and the evidence.
Protection against cruel and unusual punishment by the State.
The right to equal protection by the laws of the State.
